page.title: 09Housing
page.content:
A few cottages were in existence around the junction of Roman Road and Forge Lane in about 1690,a few parts of these remain today. Little Aston Hall, built originally in the sixteenth century, was replaced by the modern Hall in the eighteenth century; this Hall has recently been converted into luxury flats.
The other houses in the area are mainly twentieth century, there is a complete range of all types of housing from council houses to luxury residences. On the Staffordshire side the remaining land is green belt and is being preserved as such, but almost all the open spaces on the Four Oaks side have been, or will soon be, covered with housing estates.
